issue.title: Document that Error::source() types can not be depended on

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Effort: easy. A task that would be a great starting point for a new contributor.

labels.name: C-feature
labels.description: Category: feature. This is adding a new feature.

labels.name: B-breaking-change
labels.description: Blocked: this is an "API breaking change".

issue.body: All sources/causes in `hyper::Error` should be wrapped in a private `Opaque` type that still prints (`impl Debug` and `impl Display`) the message, but makes the type no longer leak through `err.downcast::<Blah>()`.

body: I filed a proposal for the working group: https://github.com/rust-lang/project-error-handling/issues/53

There hasn't been any progress on the proposal in the working group. To move forward, we can update hyper to format the way many in the ecosystem expect it to. If something better ever gets proposed and accepted, we can do that then.

issue.title: feat(error): change `Display for Error` to only print top error
issue.body:
hyper's `Error` used to print the error source automatically, preferring to provide a better default for users who do not know about `Report`. But, to fit better with the wider ecosystem, this changes the format to only print the hyper `Error` itself, and not its source.

Closes #2844

BREAKING CHANGE: The format no longer prints the error chain. Be sure to
  check if you are logging errors directly.

  The `Error::message()` method is removed, it is no longer needed.

  The `Error::into_cause()` method is removed.
